Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and George J. Lewis, Dungeons and Dragons is an action-packed stunt extravaganza with a terrific score by Alex Roman. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to wander the streets by the townspeople, gets revenge on all of them. Well, until they ultimately band together and destroy the cat.
What starts off with some deliciously creepy scenes is acted out as a dramatised tale of biblical proportions by the townsfolk of the small town,
